node.title: What Do You Want to Know About Kids and Vaccines?
node.alt: Administering a Pfizer-BioNTech shot to a 13-year-old at a clinic in Orange, Calif., in August.
node.description: The Times is hosting a live chat with a pediatric infectious disease specialist and two reporters about the coronavirus vaccine and children. Weâ€™d like to hear your questions.
node.content: ["The Times is hosting a live audio conversation on Twitter about the coronavirus vaccine and children at 5 p.m. ET on Monday, Nov. 8. To tune in, follow @nytimes and look for a notification at the top of the Twitter app at that time. Click on this link to set up a reminder for the chat. We also plan to share a recording of the conversation.", "Submit your questions below. Dr. Uzma Hasan, the division chief of pediatric infectious diseases at Saint Barnabas Medical Center, and our reporters Apoorva Mandavilli and Tara Parker-Pope may address them during the chat."]
